content: hey friends and fellow crafters in my December game I wanted to give my
players a gift and I had a problem at the table one of it was we play 5e and
they we use the inspiration dye so if you you can award the player an
inspiration dye and they can have it until they need to use it well we were
using chips to mark that and you know we have a pretty big table and pretty big
group and we're throwing chips and they're flying everywhere and you know
trying to catch them and all that stuff so I was kind of annoyed actually so I
came up with an idea to use these little pedestals that I can make to set the
inspiration dye on and then when they use it when they gets the inspiration
they can put the dye on it when they use it they could take it off and these were
this is a fun little craft easy to do but they look great and they're really
dynamic and that kind of thing and I was just really happy to give my players
they were really excited to receive him and I thought I would share with you
guys just how fun and easy these are to make so you can make them if you're a DM
you can make them for your group if you're if you have a spouse that plays
you can make them for your spouse or your friends they're just really easy to
make and I want to get this video out there so people wanted to make a gift
during the holiday season they could do that so let's hit the table and we'll
start talking about those inspiration dices pillars
gonna start the craft a little differently today and show you the
completed tower and here's one of the completed die holder towers I think it's
really cool just perfect for holding the inspiration dies so I really like the
detail and they're super easy to do so let me show you what it looks like here
loaded so when you get the inspiration die you just load it just put it on
there and then when you use it you just take it off so and then you know when
you do do or don't have inspiration so here's another example the dragon pack I
got had a bunch of different dragons so I made all different dragons on these
towers and it has a nice felt bottom so you know you won't scuff any tables or
anything so yeah I think there's a really fun and a great gift for your
players as well as very practical so let's hit the table and make those
alright for the construction of my die holder I'm going to use these wooden
spools and these are gonna be the tower part of the project then I'm gonna use
these checker pieces and these will be upside down these will be the bowls that
hold actually hold the die on top of the tower then I got these two inch wooden
disks that I used for the base of the project I also picked up these dragons I
got these from this bag of dragons I actually got these from images ordered
these on Amazon and I like these because there's quite a few in here and there's
two of each type so that's pretty cool so they won't all look the same the
Dragons will look different I also got a Wat a two inch washer and then I'll give
a nice weight to the base alright frenzy here's our components I'm
gonna use this e six thousand which is basically goop it's just another name
for goop I got to put on the washer there and adhere that to the wood base
so they'll give a nice weight then I'm gonna take the checker and put it on the
pillar or the spool upside down and I'm gonna glue the spool and attach it to
the base kind of offset alright because I don't put the dragon on that later now
I have a black bomb dead flat black and I'm going to use my gray and my sponge
technique it's a damp sponge and just start filling in the pillar and the base
and get a really nice stone texture on there just
that on just fill it all in okay now I'm going to use a lighter gray and the
lighter rail kind of get the highlights I'm going to go around the edges of the
spool kind of make those pop out it gives a nice highlight there and a few
dabs elsewhere you know you know on the pillar and the base and then go around
the edging of the base to give it a nice highlight so there we go cool all right
now I'm going to use a nice platinum metallic it's a kind of an interesting
creamy metallic I'm gonna use that for the cup at the top I kind of like this
color it's not really really bright silver right okay now I'm gonna use my
dragon and I'm gonna paint the same way I washed it with soap and water and then
I spray-painted that flat black and now I'm gonna dry brush this platinum on so
it'll match the cup and really nice really cool and there finish that up
I'll be ready to go now I'm going to use some green this is ivy green and I want
to do a little bit of a color variance on this so it's not just all grey I'm
gonna have kind of some kind of vines going up the pillar like I'm gonna dab
some looks like some vegetation growing on there right now I'm gonna use a leafy
green with my sponge again and kind of dab that on so like the leaves of the
vine like running up the pillar and on the base really gives a nice little
color variation to that piece all right cool looking good all right now I need
to add the felt bottom so I'm just gonna use my e6000 and there's the felt just
using a great nice gray felt and make sure you go out to the edge because you
want to stick nicely to the felt and just fill it all in and just stick it on
the felt and let it dry have a nice smooth bottom okay now I'm gonna cut
around just cut around the circle be careful take your time and you'll just
have a nice smooth cut around that edge there if you just take your time and
you're careful all right cool there we go
all her dirty tables now I did pick up these little swords off of Amazon
they're like little charms and I'm gonna put this I thought this would be fun to
put on the front is a little extra added detail so I'll just line that up on the
front there vertically nice I also picked up these gems and you can get
these in any craft store there but these are kind of cool too you look at them
different angles and they're they change colors that's kind of like that so I'm
gonna put the small gem on the sword there's two different sizes and a larger
gem on the cup just above the sword have a nice detail there cool I really like
that alright now the dragon I want to adhere to the base nicely so I'm gonna
scuff the feet up I'm gonna scrape the paint off the bottom of the feet that
way when I adhere it it won't just it won't just come off because it'll be
adhered to the paint it'll actually be adhere to the model the dragon model
itself and so it shouldn't come off right so I'll just skip all those feet
up so I get a nice adhesion on the base and then I'll use my e6000 again and put
it on the feet and I'll stick it on the base and these will be ready to go there
we go a nice Fivey inspiration dye holder
